Lars Clausen wrote:
> First diff is of the startcrawl.sh script, which was lacking some quotes
> in tests, and more importantly the test for -no-wui was broken so it
> always ran no-wui.

Thanks!

> I also have some questions about the new CVS version of Heritrix -- I
> see the order.xml format has changed dramatically.  Now I'm trying to
> make a crawl that takes just the front URL from each of a number of
> sites, but the new version doesn't seem to have the max-embed-depth
> parameter of a few weeks ago.  Just to sanity check:  Is it in there
> somewhere, or shall I make my own filter for it?

It's now the "max-trans-hops" attribute on the <scope> element,
because it serves as a limit on other forms of "transitive"
inclusion of URIs, as well as embedded resources.

For example, preconditions (robots/dns), META-refreshes,
Javascript-speculative-guesses, and HTTP redirects all count
as transitive hops.

So to achieve what it seems you want: add each of the sites you
want to crawl to the seeds, set the "max-link-hops" to zero,
set the "max-trans-hops" to something likely to get all
legitimately transcluded URIs, but able to cut pathological
situations short. (I currently think 5 is a good value.)

Keep the questions coming!

- Gordon
